revised_title: Determination of Pendulum Lengths in Different Latitudes
tldr: The article discusses an experiment conducted by George Graham and Colin Campbell to determine the difference in the lengths of isochronal pendulums in London and Jamaica. They used a clock with a pendulum made by Graham to compare the timekeeping in both locations. The results showed that the clock lost 54 minutes and 21 seconds in 26 revolutions of stars in Jamaica compared to London, indicating that the length of the pendulum was affected by the heat and the force of gravity in the two places.
